website_summaries.verdict: This functional lint roller pack comes at a high value as it contains 5 rollers with 95 sheets on each, totaling a whopping 475 sheets.
pros: These are just sticky enough to pick up lint and pet hair without unraveling from roll when in use
Roller paper is of high quality
Sheets are easy to rip off once filled with debris
Handle of rollers are light and easy to grip
cons: Every so often, it may be difficult not to accidentally tear off more than one sheet at a time

website_summaries.verdict: A good lint roller from a trusted brand that you can trust not to damage sensitive surfaces.
pros: Includes a total of 475 sheets with an ergonomic handle
Sheets are easy to tear and the adhesive won't damage formal clothing or sensitive surfaces
cons: Isn't quite as sticky as some other brands

customer_reviews.title: I love these for cleaning up pet hair and keep them ...
customer_reviews.text: I love these for cleaning up pet hair and keep them handy wherever my cat likes to sleep. Cleaning hair off furniture is a breeze with them, but one day, I decided to go to the source. Now my cat comes running for a "massage" whenever she hears the roller! I don't press hard so it doesn't pull hair. It has definitely helped cut back on her hair on my bed, chairs, couch, and so on... After several months using these, now my cat comes running when she hears me take the cover off! Loves her massage...
customer_reviews.author: Misty Becker

customer_reviews.title: Terrible. Not sticky at all
customer_reviews.text: You get what you pay for. These are terrible. Maybe if you’re just picking up white lint off of a black jacket – but if you really want them to work like take a pet hair off your couch or off your pants. Good luck. They are the least sticky thing I’ve ever used that supposed to be sticky.
customer_reviews.author: Sara

customer_reviews.title: Barely even sticky :(
customer_reviews.text: Being Scotch brand, I thought these would be at least as good as the generic brand I get at WalMart, but they are dreadful. They are barely even sticky, they don't pick up much of anything, and it takes 5 times as many of them to do the job my generic ones do with one sheet.
customer_reviews.author: Idahome

customer_reviews.title: Great for removing pet hair from uniforms
customer_reviews.text: My husband goes through lint rollers constantly. He wears uniforms at work so these get used every day. These are better than the super cheap budget lint rollers that have super thin paper that doesn't tear off easily. These collect pet hair well and each sheet tears off without much hassle. There's been some back and forth on here with people receiving different types of sets of 5 rollers. Some people getting 3 large rollers and 2 small rollers, and some getting 5 large rollers. I ordered directly from Amazon (not one of the other sellers) and received 5 full size rollers. So the sizes you get may have to do with which seller you are ordering from.
customer_reviews.author: Where the Sidewalk Ends

customer_reviews.title: I do not like these rollers
customer_reviews.text: I do not like these rollers! They're poor quality, very thin material and they don't pick up very much lint. I didn't realize that's what I was purchasing but if I had seen them in a store I would have known better.
customer_reviews.author: Angela Perez

customer_reviews.title: My cat is crazy for this.
customer_reviews.text: I took a previous reviewer's advice and used the lint roller on my cat. He absolutely LOVES this. He is nuts to have me roll over this his back and tail. Plus it picks off all his loose hair to boot.
customer_reviews.author: blaze

customer_reviews.title: Fatal Design Flaw in Otherwise Great Product
customer_reviews.text: The sticky roll will jam. That is because it uses the handle as its axis for rotation, instead of having an inner roller to separate the sticky tape from the handle. That means there is no way to stop the innermost piece of sticky tape from adhering to the handle, as the tape roll rotates. And once it stops rotating, it becomes useless. You will be without choice but to discard half the tape roll, unused. I have been a subscriber to these sticky rolls; and so, I have used many of them. Without exception, the rollers jam because of that design flaw. I just can't deal with it, anymore. I am finished with this product. No more purchases.
customer_reviews.author: Apoiuwerhpga

customer_reviews.title: To quote the Beatles, "I'm a believer!"
customer_reviews.text: I was a a bit skeptical as to value, but no more. These things WORK, and are a great value as far as I'm concerned. I wear black uniforms to school, and I need to look professional. Add in three cats, a home in the country, and a girlfriend's kids who flat out refuse to clean up after themselves, and I'm ALWAYS wiping down lint and hair before leaving for work. It drove me nuts. No more. 30 seconds rolling a few sheets over myself from this gadget before leaving for school, and I am blessedly lint and cat hair free! I also roller furniture, my car, it just works!
customer_reviews.author: Art Welling

customer_reviews.title: Where all the positive reviews come from???
customer_reviews.text: THE QUALITY IS HORRIBLE. Is this a counterfeit product?? It does not perform like ScotchBrite I used to buy. it is not sticky enough to stay on the roll so if you roll it up and down it unrolls on itself and you waste three to 4 sheets just to clean it up. I'll open the other one and test it to make sure it's not just this one but I'm very disappointed
customer_reviews.author: JB&AB

customer_reviews.title: Not the quality I would expect from 3M
customer_reviews.text: The adhesive seems strong enough, does a good job go picking up cat hair. But, the perforations between the sheets are even STRONGER than the adhesive, so when you attempt to remove a used-up sheet, they just keep unwinding. You have to manually restrain the fresh sheet on the roll in order to get the old one to tear off.
customer_reviews.author: Anonymous Coward

customer_reviews.title: A Pet Owner’s Necessity, But Refills Aren’t Worth It.
customer_reviews.text: If you’re a pet owner you need this product, end of story. I decided to purchase a pack so I could always have one in my house and in my car. The amount of hair that these pick up is sometimes shocking. I use it about twice a week on my couches and it’s make a remarkable difference in my breathing. *The only reason I knocked off a star is because getting the 6 pack with handles is the same prices as the refills but has more sheets in it. It doesn’t make sense that the ones with handles are more cost effective than the refills, that just encourages waste.
customer_reviews.author: Eric L.

customer_reviews.title: Must-Have!
customer_reviews.text: A must-have for anyone with shedding pets! I have purchased many lint rollers to use on our pet hair, but I keep coming back to these. They are cost effective, and I love the huge rolls. The multi-pack is wonderful for us, and we haven't actually run out of rollers since I started purchasing the bigger rolls and package. They really pick up the hairs and lint, and the sheets are easy to pull off once you figure out the trick (hold the roller in the right hand, and yank the sheet from the top with the left).
customer_reviews.author: LauraM

customer_reviews.title: Works as expected
customer_reviews.text: At first I wasn't sure about these.... they're a little less sticky that some others that I have used, but I have come to appreciate it that they are only picking up what they need and leaving the other fibers alone. They sheets have a vinyl feel compared to other more paper-y ones. It takes a few passes and multiple sheets to get everything, but as a dog owner who is using this daily, I think it will be healthier for my clothes. Also, they are extremely sticky to each other, so be careful when storing them.
customer_reviews.author: Steven

customer_reviews.title: This is not the good stuff.
customer_reviews.text: It's not very sticky so I go through the sheets pretty quickly. The perforations don't line up so when you tear off a sheet it has half a centimeter of unused surface on it. These are white and plasticky, not like the good ones which are more like masking tape. Maybe this would be good for use on something delicate such as velvet but for removing cat hair from regular clothes these are a little disappointing - they don't have a whole lot of lifting power. They're not totally useless just a little weaker than I would like.
customer_reviews.author: RebeccaJ

customer_reviews.title: Just what I needed
customer_reviews.text: I have a white cat who sheds enough to give me a second cat. And of course loves to rub against my pant leg when I'm on my way out the door. LOL I always seem to run out of lint rollers just when I need one the most. So getting this many in a package at a good price was great. They work as well as others and better than some. They do pull off the roll easier than most and that's a plus. No struggling to separate the used pieces. Will buy again.
customer_reviews.author: JoyS Ohio

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use and sticky
customer_reviews.text: I have used other "lint" rollers and these Scotch Brite are the best. The covers are easy to remove when dirty and there are many of them on each roller. I find them quite sticky for the purpose of picking up, in my case, cat hair. Initially, the roller is a bit hard to turn when "rollering" the cat but it loosens up with use and the cat accepts it. It does not seem to dry out when sitting and not in use. These Scotch Brite lint rollers are definitely my new best lint roller. Try them.
customer_reviews.author: Karl59062

customer_reviews.title: Kinda noisy
customer_reviews.text: I’ve always had one in every place I could think of. They rip off clean 99% of the time (with the 1% being human error like not gripping correctly). They’re kinda bulky, since they have so many sheets, so can’t leave them out in the open without it looking like a decoration, so they’re usually a drawer or behind something else. They’re kinda loud, which is funny to say kinda bugs me. Example: I work in a quiet office, 7am is my start time, so I tend to wait a few hours for others to start coming in prior to using, because the noise the roller makes is super loud and I get embarrassed. Otherwise, great product. Will buy again!
customer_reviews.author: MarisolTheGreat

customer_reviews.title: Sheets come off the roll as you use it
customer_reviews.text: As some of the other reviews indicate - these sheets stick to the thing you are removing lint from more than the roll itself, so the result is that as you roll, you are just unwrapping the roll. You can sort of make it work if you roll only in one direction. Frustrating, difficult to use. Not recommended. Annoyed that I bought the bulk pack.
customer_reviews.author: B P

customer_reviews.title: Awful.
customer_reviews.text: The sheets of paper keep rolling so you end up wasting half the roll cause you can't unwind it once it comes off. Sometimes it won't but usually, it does and this is just very frustrating to use. It picks up pet hair somewhat well put the annoyance of the paper waste makes this a terrible choice. I have bought this a couple of times and this only has happened to me recently so I don't know if they did something or if I was just lucky before.
customer_reviews.author: Edward Z

customer_reviews.title: The sheets don't always stay stuck down when rolling
customer_reviews.text: This product did a good job cleaning up dog hair, which is the main reason I purchased it. The issue I have had is that when you tear off a sheet and start to roll again, the next sheet in line oftentimes gets stuck on your clothes/on itself and unravels. You then have to tear that piece off and try again, sometimes wasting several sheets at a time. It doesn't matter how careful you are when tearing off a sheet, this issue still happens often.
customer_reviews.author: Austin Bohanon

customer_reviews.title: Great product for dog hair
customer_reviews.text: These have been a lifesaver around my house. I mean they don't get up every single piece of hair but they definitely get up most of it. I'm ordering another round as I've finished the 5 that I have. The only thing that I would change is making the rolls a lot thicker. I get a little tired of having to rip off the sheet since I have a large shedder. Even with vacuuming first, I'm ripping off sheet after sheet. Twice the size would come in handy and I'd pay twice the price.
customer_reviews.author: Review Happy

customer_reviews.title: Good Lint Roller Multi-Pack
customer_reviews.text: Good-sized lint rollers that last a long time even with multiple uses per day. Thank you to the previous reviewers who noted that the used sheet does sometimes pull off an unused sheet along with it. To keep this from happening when I use my roller, I make sure that I'm rolling it in one direction, rather than up and down. It's really great for removing hair and fur from clothing and for quick touch ups. I've purchased generic non-brand name lint rollers but they didn't have the same sticking power.
customer_reviews.author: Diana

customer_reviews.title: Good but they're overpriced now
customer_reviews.text: I've been using these for years to keep cat hair under control and they worked well enough for the cost at the time to keep coming back for more but the price on these has jumped nearly $8 in the last few months. The cost of these is now too much and I can't recommend them at this price point any longer.
customer_reviews.author: Mistheonist

customer_reviews.title: I needed these
customer_reviews.text: I should have bought these long ago. There's just no substitute for these if you've got furry "kids". There's a tremendous number of "tapes" on each roller. If I had to name a negative, well: I'm trying to think of what I could do with the handles to re-use, once the tape has been used up (since I try not to add to the "waste stream" by putting plastic items into the trash...and I don't think these would go into the recycling bin), but I'm coming up blank. In other words, I wish these were a little more "green". On the other hand, it seems like the tape itself is paper-based, so maybe it will decompose. Just saying !
customer_reviews.author: Barefoot Belle

customer_reviews.title: Stickly, But Awkward, Bulky and A Bit Tough To Use Easily
customer_reviews.text: I really wanted to like these. I need good tape rollers good for dog hair. These are the most frustrating rollers. Oddly, even though they are very sticky (good), you can only roll one direction with them or they unroll. The perforated sections aren't perforated enough, so you have to yank hard to tear them and then the tape flips back on itself and you lose use of about 1/3 of sheet of each section much of the time. They are filled with a bit too much tape, so at first they are bulky and weird to use since they are continually coming unrolled when you want them to stay just where they are to get the hair off.
customer_reviews.author: Lorca

customer_reviews.title: Meh
customer_reviews.text: Not the greatest but not the worst either. There is not as much sticky as my last lint rollers but couldn’t find them any more. They are ok for cat hair but it will take a couple of sheets. I also keep one in my sewing room to pick up threads and as with cat hair, I go through more sheets because they loose the sticky pick up. Not bad. Just not great.
customer_reviews.author: Diana P

customer_reviews.title: Over priced
customer_reviews.text: When I purchased this, it was pretty expensive. Not having ever purchased them before, I didn't know how good of a deal it was. Well, I passed by some in the store not too long afterwards and much to my chagrin, I saw that I paid about double what I could have. So, buyer beware. However, they definitely do a great job of cleaning up clothing.
customer_reviews.author: Paul

customer_reviews.title: Lots of Uses
customer_reviews.text: These are great! I not only use them to remove lint from clothing, but also to clean crumbs from my suede dining chairs. I keep a separate lint roller in the dining room for that. I also keep a separate lint roller for cleaning my bathroom rugs between machine washings because trying to vacuum them causes the rugs to be sucked up noisily into the vacuum cleaner. You can also keep a separate one in your bedside table for picking up the cracker crumbs in your bed, if you have that problem.
customer_reviews.author: AMK

customer_reviews.title: Bad batch maybe, but these rolls are useless
customer_reviews.text: I've purchased this product several times, and they were great in the past but this last batch is completely useless. When rolling over a surface, the roll unravels as you roll. It's very sticky, except it doesn't stick to itself to stay on the roll until you peel it off. After several sheets unroll they stick to themselves as you try to remove the blob from the roll - then more sheets unroll. Each time I use this product instead of one sheet it easily uses 5-7 sheets each time, mostly rolled up in a sticky blob. Truly impossible to use. May as well buy sheets of masking tape.
customer_reviews.author: Ellie

customer_reviews.title: Not very sticky...
customer_reviews.text: Not as good as I'd hoped... I guess that's why it's a 5 pack ... you need to use about 5 strips each morning... Maybe if you don't wear black and don't have any pets that shed allover, these might work for ' normal lint and fuzz' ...
customer_reviews.author: Lilian

customer_reviews.title: Great product. Don't believe the negitive reviews.
customer_reviews.text: I saw some negitive reviews before the product arrived. Now.. after using it, it's wonderful. Although, if I had so much built up dander and hair, it would take an extra free to remove the excess. This product works very well and I recommend it. I will buy again. I have a dog and a cat. It collects the shed hair, even my own without problem. Thanks
customer_reviews.author: J. Doug Phillips

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't work.
customer_reviews.text: Maybe it us just me since this product has such great reviews, but these rollers pretty much don't work. I have two cats and bought them to try to keep my clothes relatively free of cat fur. After repeated rolls with fresh sheets my clothes are still full of cat fur.
customer_reviews.author: L. Ferreira

customer_reviews.title: Best lint roller I have found...
customer_reviews.text: Love these... usually Costco is less expensive but this beat even Costco. I have a cat so lint rollers are a must. My cat loves me to use it in her. Every time she hears me using it she runs from downstairs or wherever in the house, even will jump up from napping and stand at attention for me to use the roller on her. It’s works like a charm, heavy duty and best stickiness I have found out there!
customer_reviews.author: RGO

customer_reviews.title: Love these - indispensable
customer_reviews.text: We have a 15-pound Cavalier King Charles Spaniel, and he leaves hair everywhere. I go through these lint rollers like nobody's business. I tried the reusable ones, which seemed like a brilliant idea, but you only get one roll and then you need to wash and wait for it to dry. I tried the new lint rollers, but they collapse while you are trying to use them. I used an old lint roller that I had that had separate sheets for each level. The continuous perforated sheets in this lint roller makes it extremely easy to use. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Amity

customer_reviews.title: No more pet hair!
customer_reviews.text: Best price and quality I've found anywhere!!! Very sticky roller sheets and they last a long time. Perfect for homes with pets! I have one hanging on our key hooks by the garage door so I can use it real quick before going to work or wherever for the day. I also have one hanging in the coat closet by the front door for visitors, and one in each bathroom as well as one in the laundry room. Never have to look for the "one" lint roller again!
customer_reviews.author: Steffie

customer_reviews.title: Removes All The Pet Fur From Clothes and Furniture.
customer_reviews.text: This is a required tool sound my house which is dominated by a Siberian Husky. I love my pet, but he sheds like a constant rain LOL! I have placed one of these in every bedroom and by every door so that we can leave the house without looking like we've been rolling around in white fur. Despite daily vacuuming, the battle is ongoing. This tool removes all the fur from our clothes in only a minute or two so that we are once again tidy and ready to go. Thanks for this handy device that saves the day for my family and our furry friend.
customer_reviews.author: Kymara

customer_reviews.title: Do you have a pet or do you shed a lot?
customer_reviews.text: If the answer was yes to either of those this is a must have. Honestly I can't tell you how often I use these damn things. I have a long hair cat and she sheds everywhere.somehow I get cat hair on my fresh clothes out of the laundry that's how much damn hair she has. These bad boys are the only thing that picks them up. I swear I won't be able to live my life on normal human life without these.
customer_reviews.author: Will Chin-Lee

customer_reviews.title: Sheets will not detach from roll easily
customer_reviews.text: We received our usual order of lint rollers and opened one roll immediately. The perforations between sheets were not complete. Each time we used it, we had to hold onto the edge of the roller or the sheets would just unroll with each swipe of the roller. Every roller had this problem. Never had a problem with this brand before. Cannot recommend at this time.
customer_reviews.author: Ray M. Bishop

customer_reviews.title: I figured Scotch-Brite would be a quality product, but ...
customer_reviews.text: I figured Scotch-Brite would be a quality product, but I can barely use these rollers. if I don't roll the "right" way, the sheet sticks to my clothes and unrolls from the roll. even if I do roll the "right" way, sometimes after a few "right" swipes I would expect the roll to work as intended - BUT NO. I will be out of these in no time because I have 5 cats, so lint-rolling is a daily occurrence in my house... but this product makes it a pain. not entirely sure why because not all rollers have the same problem. either way, I won't be buying this brand when I am through with the rolls I currently have.
customer_reviews.author: amber liz

customer_reviews.title: Best I've found... And I have tried many..
customer_reviews.text: I've tried about every brand of these and this one is the best by far. They are great for picking up pet hair, dust, lint, etc. on clothes and furniture. The sheets are completely sticky and pick up even though the sheet looks used. The sheets tear apart evenly and consistently, a great value for the money.
customer_reviews.author: Lorelyle

customer_reviews.title: I am a professional Rideshare driver with Lyft and Uber. Everybody says that these are handy to keep ...
customer_reviews.text: I am a professional Rideshare driver with Lyft and Uber. Everybody says that these are handy to keep around for taking up the stray occasional pet hair or glitter makeup that so many girl passengers use nowadays. Honestly, I would do better with Scotch tape or duct tape wrapped around my hand. These really don't do the job.
customer_reviews.author: Scott E. Kingsbury

customer_reviews.title: USED TO BE A RELIABLE EXCELLENT PRODUCT
customer_reviews.text: This product used to be excellent; however, the last two purchases have come with a minimum of two bad rolls that will not roll on your clothing. It’s a complete waste of a roll because there’s nothing you can do to repair them. Extremely frustrating and a waste of money because the refund time period had expired both times. I have purchased this product for years but will never buy it again.
customer_reviews.author: All About Purrs / Lisa

customer_reviews.title: Expected better quality due to brand.
customer_reviews.text: These are so annoying. I ordered these because you couldn't beat the price. I resell clothing so I go through my share of lint rollers. These are not as sticky as other brands I have purchased before and you have to be really carefully when peeling off the used sheet because they will pull up the new one as well.
customer_reviews.author: Luna

customer_reviews.title: Picks up pet hair and easy to remove the used sheets
customer_reviews.text: We recently got two Pomeranians are shedding a lot. These lint rollers do a good job of picking up the hair, both from our clothes and from rugs and furniture. Best of all, it's easy to peel the used sheets off and easy to tell where the next sheet starts. Got a pack of four so each family member has their own in their bedroom. The rollers themselves are standard size so can take just about any brand of refill, but I'll probably stick with the ScotchBrite refills since they're working well for us.
customer_reviews.author: Cascade book lover

customer_reviews.title: You get what you pay for
customer_reviews.text: Received 5 lint rollers in a pack and based off of the reviews and the price ($10.79) I decided to purchase them but upon receiving them I noticed off the bat that they are not sticky at all! I get better lint rollers at the dollar store. It took me 7 sheets to lint roll one of my sweater sleeves and even then the sleeve was not free of lint. Will not be purchasing again. Ended up throwing them all away and purchased the lint roller brand "Evercare". A little pricier but a difference in quality.
customer_reviews.author: Karen Delgado

customer_reviews.title: No good
customer_reviews.text: Like others, I thought these would be good because of the brand. However, they aren't all that effective in removing pet hair. And though they dont remove hair well, they do stick better to some of my clothes than they do to themselves, so the roll unravels as I use them. I'll go back to the generics from the dollar store- these seem nice, but even plain old masking tape works better.
customer_reviews.author: MM

customer_reviews.title: Problematic storage and/or display.
customer_reviews.text: My two most recent orders of a half a dozen 5 packs of the Scotch Brite lint rollers just arrived. However, I was disappointed to find that the rollers were not secured together with a transparent plastic wrapper as usual but were packed loose within a small cardboard box. Each box had to be opened to check its contents and I was shorted one lint roller. Also, the cardboard boxes take up more space when storing the lint rollers for future use or sale.
customer_reviews.author: James Arness

customer_reviews.title: Not Sticky at All
customer_reviews.text: These claim to be super sticky but sadly they are super non-sticky, I have purchased Stickier ones for a fraction of the price. Not worth the price.
customer_reviews.author: L.G.Viprino

customer_reviews.title: I would never buy this again
customer_reviews.text: There's minimal adhesive; you have to roll and roll and roll to pull anything off. This means that you have to keep tearing off the used piece ... way, way too often. It is also hard to pull off each new piece. On a scale of 1-10, I'd give it a 5. It's quite annoying.
customer_reviews.author: J. Cupas

customer_reviews.title: The Best....
customer_reviews.text: Simply put, this is the best lint roller period. I have 2 German Shepards and the roller is amazing at picking up tons of hair. Easy to peel to get to the nexy sheet. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Bob

customer_reviews.title: Can't go wrong with these bad boys.
customer_reviews.text: Can't go wrong with these bad boys. I keep one in the bathroom and in my closet so I can swipe at lint when I see it in different light. I fist stated using them when I lived with a roomie with 2 cats. Lint rolling was a multi-day occurrence back then, but these rollers seemed to last quite a while. Now that I am living animal free, a single roller seems to last forever, and the sheets retain the right amount of tack.
customer_reviews.author: Jen

customer_reviews.title: Save me from guinea pigs hair!
customer_reviews.text: Guinea pig shed SO MUCH so I decided to get these and boy am I impressed! They are easy to use and pick up hair YES they ACTUALLY pick up hairs! Awesome! One thing tho sometime it can be hard to tear and sometimes it rolls out of you aren’t careful (whoops) but I’m not picky and if it pick up hairs it serve it purpose! So yea I recommend it :)
customer_reviews.author: Rada

customer_reviews.text: Does the job but you can get 6 sheets when you want to tear off 2. Great value for your money. I will buy again knowing what to expect.
customer_reviews.author: PJD

customer_reviews.title: Unraveling and sticking to next sheet.
customer_reviews.text: While these work ok if you can keep sheets from unraveling and sticking to one another that is a huge problem. They tear at perforated edges but not it you don't use both hands to keep them from unraveling. If you are holding garment it is almost impossible to use. I've used these before and they have changed for the worse.
customer_reviews.author: Raine

customer_reviews.title: The best cat hair removal lint brush out there!
customer_reviews.text: We have three indoor cats, and with that said, you might imagine the amount of loose hair that our clothes and furniture pick up. We use the rollers mostly for de-hairing our clothes--especially before going out of the house, cooking or putting clothes into the hamper. I loved the 5 pack of these rollers and keep one in the bathroom, bedroom, kitchen, laundry room and living room.
customer_reviews.author: Sally

customer_reviews.title: Third order. Never had a problem before.
customer_reviews.text: This was my third order of the multi pack. We have a dog who sheds and we use these a lot. Have never had a problem until this order. One roller was not very sticky at all. The roller we are using now, the Sticky sheets won’t spin on the hand roller and it’s almost impossible to use. We keeps trying to loosen it up.
customer_reviews.author: Katie in Kansas

customer_reviews.title: It’s ok
customer_reviews.text: When removing used sheet it is sometimes frustrating because it does not tear on the seem lines causing more sticky sheets to be rolled out.
customer_reviews.author: Claudia Rodriguez

customer_reviews.title: Best lint rollers ever!
customer_reviews.text: I love these! Such a great deal, especially when you use them so much! I run a small clothing business, so I use them in my office a lot, as well as all over the house! Furniture, clothes, anything! We have a golden retriever so we cannot live without these things. About ready to purchase another pack! Thanks SO much!!! :)
customer_reviews.author: Molly McKeever

customer_reviews.title: They're great
customer_reviews.text: Lint Rollers can be $4 per jumbo roll. That says it all for under $12 you can get 5 of them? Definitely the best deal around. They aren't the stickiest I've used but the are still very sticky so they take care of lots of pet hair. They tear easily because the perforations are always as deep as they need to be but never so deep you get 2 sheets off by mistake.
customer_reviews.author: Grizzly Bear

customer_reviews.title: So irritating! Don't buy... So cheap, it comes undone while using
customer_reviews.text: Very much dislike these..... Every time I use it it always comes undone. It's just not sticky enough to stay stuck to itself. So I get frustrated every time and waste lots of sheets...... I like the super sticky ones this brand makes, however I will never buy these again!!!!
customer_reviews.author: SHAUNA P.

customer_reviews.title: Good for a lot of cleaning
customer_reviews.text: I've always used lint rollers but now I have more uses for them. They will remove dust from lampshades and I use them to clean my area rugs which is easier than pulling out the vacuum. Also great for window screens.
customer_reviews.author: Fussy

customer_reviews.title: Glad I got!
customer_reviews.text: Got tired of going to the store for one roller and then running out fast. I was nervous that these might have been the cheap rollers with the sheets that didn’t work great but the paper is nice and thick. And works great!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Best rollers for pet hair
customer_reviews.text: Best rollers out there - especially for pet hair. I made the mistake of buying a cheaper brand on Amazon that had great reviews. It was a total waste. These actually stay on the handle no matter how hard you press and they get all the pet hair off every time.
customer_reviews.author: pdeldc

customer_reviews.title: Pretty good for hair
customer_reviews.text: My girlfriend works at a hair salon and is covered in hair at the end of the day. I bought here these for her clothes post work, and it does a really good job of getting all the tiny hair splinters off of her and out of her shirt and leggings where they tend to imbed themselves. These are indispensable for the hair salon life.
customer_reviews.author: influence peddler

customer_reviews.title: Just ok
customer_reviews.text: A great buy for someone just trying to remove lint from their clothes. Unfortunately I have a dog with course hair, that finds a way to embed itself into my clothes. The roller will pick up what's laying on the surface of the material, but they won't get all of the hair. I honestly don't know if that's just this brand or if I will be able to find a roller that will do what I need it to. I'm going to try the kind that are specifically for pet hair.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not recommended for medium dog hair removal!
customer_reviews.text: This product does not work well for dog hair removal on fabric. You have to use 3X the amount of sheets to remove hair. I have go over it again with roller from Home Depot/Brand to remove the remaining dog hair. I would not recommend this product for dog hair removal. Actually shocked they don’t work well, I would return if I hadn’t used half a roller already.
customer_reviews.author: Coleman Ridenour

customer_reviews.title: No more cat hair! (Or lint)
customer_reviews.text: I live in a small space with two cats. There is hair everywhere. These lint rollers are fantastic. The sheets are super sticky (enough to pick up LEGOs on the carpet) and don't come unraveled until you pull them off. These perform well beyond the lint rollers that I have used in the past, and would recommend them to family/friends with pets. Oh, and they also remove lint, dirt and dust from clothing too. An excellent purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Monkey Frazzler

customer_reviews.title: Useful for everyone
customer_reviews.text: which is great because for whatever reason I received a double order (and was charged for it too!), but returns are a hassle, so I am giving several away in addition to one in the car, one in several rooms; use to run over sheets in morning to remove any cat hair so handy. Tears off evenly unlike other brands, and really really picks up every little thing.
customer_reviews.author: Moanakai

customer_reviews.title: Keep the fuzz away
customer_reviews.text: So this was such a good deal. We have one in every room almost, plenty to take to work, keep in the car or have as spares. These are very sticky and do a good job at picking up all the unwanted stuff off your clotes or fabrics. I had other ones that were worthless and you had to pass them on a million times to pick stuff up but these ones are nice and sticky and can collect a good amount before you have to change the sheet. Well worth the buy in my oppinion.
customer_reviews.author: Priscilla G.

customer_reviews.title: It is so not sticky, when you roll it on clothing it tends to peal multiple sheets.
customer_reviews.text: This product is not worth the money. When you roll it on clothing it tends to peal multiple sheets. I does pick up lint when it isn't completely unwinding itself. Each time I use it, I lose at least 5 sheets because it just unwinds. So now I have to be careful about the direction I roll.
customer_reviews.author: Rick

customer_reviews.title: Don’t buy
customer_reviews.text: Buyer beware, this is not the normal product! We ordered these several months ago and they were great. Ordered them again, the handle has a hook on it unlike the previous order and they are not sticky AT ALL. Swipe it once and it’s unravelled 8 sheets. Returning and I won’t be buying again.
customer_reviews.author: Dilyn

customer_reviews.title: Defective, Completely unravels
customer_reviews.text: This product gives "Made in the USA" a really bad name. The whole roll of tape comes off the roll as you try to use it. It makes a big wad of mess & does little hair pick up. If you try rolling it so it does not unravel, it unravels as you pick it up. This is a totally defective product & I want my money back, it should never be sold for any purpose.
customer_reviews.author: jr winblad

customer_reviews.title: Comes unraveled while using one square and not very sticky to do a good job
customer_reviews.text: I have a had other lint rollers that worked fine. However this one as you’re rolling it over your clothing comes unraveled. Meaning it won’t just use the one square of lint remover at a time. So you’re having to roll back-and-forth to prevent it from unraveling completely and using up five or more squares of lint remover. Very poor product. The sticky part does work but I’ve had better products that are stickier and remove more.
customer_reviews.author: julie

customer_reviews.title: Should Have Bought These Years Ago
customer_reviews.text: As a bachelor living alone, I don't always take the time to wash all of my colored t-shirts with like colors...I'd end up doing 10 loads a week. So, the t-shirts get linty. Used these on my black t-shirt yesterday for the first time and it made a massive difference, cleaning nearly all of the lint off. I recommend these!
customer_reviews.author: Aaron Kirkpatrick

customer_reviews.title: Works fine for dog hair; not aggressively sticky
customer_reviews.text: Have an odd odor compared to ones I bought in the past, but good value overall and function as expected. Know going in that these are not aggressively sticky. I primarily use to remove excess dog hair from a blanket on her side of the couch and these suit that purpose well. My pooch will even let me roll these directly on her which was surprising but indicative the level of the stickiness.
customer_reviews.author: skyway vagabond

customer_reviews.title: Extremely convenient good buy.
customer_reviews.text: I love the fact that it came with five I have them strategically placed all over my house so that way I don't have to hunt when I need one. With two cats 1 fat cat that's fur is white and everywhere it is perfect I've got one by every door in the house, at least so it seems so that way if I need to quickly hit some furniture to clear seat or if I need to get my shirt or clothes before I leave I can... The shipping was fast it did the job it's a good buy...
customer_reviews.author: Sam

customer_reviews.title: Not very sticky
customer_reviews.text: I am a hairstylist and I purchased this to remove people hair from my clothes. I assumed the Scotch brite would be a good brand name product. These are only useful for the lightest of lint removal. The strips are not very sticky and if you roll too fast they come apart from the roll and stick to each other. I would equate these to dollar store lint rollers, because you use twice as many strips due to poor quality. I regretted buying the 5 roll pack and will never purchase this brand again.
customer_reviews.author: delia tirado

customer_reviews.title: Great little lint rollers
customer_reviews.text: I can't really imagine now having these to clean all sorts of random things now. I've used them to remove a lot of random lint and what-not from all kinds of objects and surfaces, and it's almost shocking how much stuff they pick up that I couldn't really see in the first place. Each sheet picks up quite a bit and loses its stickiness quickly though. As far as I can tell, they haven't left any sticky residue behind on anything I've used them on. I happen to lose quite a bit of hair on whatever, and these also work well for cleaning my own hair up.
customer_reviews.author: Chris C.

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't even stick to itself.
customer_reviews.text: These have gotten worse over time. They had stick a year or so ago but when I rotated to the new supply I purchased from amazon they would just unravel and come apart. Oh and good luck using them in two directions because they will unroll and waist several sheets.
customer_reviews.author: Anthony

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for heavy shedding dog owners!
customer_reviews.text: My family used these daily. I keep one by the front door for a quick swipe before we head out the door. With 2 German Shepherd’s in our family, we don’t have a single article of clothing without a few stray hairs. Shepherds shed daily like a New York snowstorm! we used to use a roll of packing tape, but these work so much better and easier to use. We can’t leave home without them!
customer_reviews.author: Jillian STop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Terrible. Unrolls when you use it.
customer_reviews.text: This is poor quality. I would not purchase again. The way the stickiness is, you can only roll one direction or it starts to unroll. It picks up fine but when it unrolls while you are using it, it will stick to itself and it is like glue. You have to rip it apart and that wastes it and it is Annoying. I have a better one from the Dollar Store.
customer_reviews.author: Dattomagroup

customer_reviews.title: Very satisfied
customer_reviews.text: I use these to pick up peanut shell remnants when eating peanuts in bed. I tried another brand first ( Lint Roller Xtreme sticky Plus, 64 easy peel sheets), but it was only fair. The Scotch-Brite ones are much better.
customer_reviews.author: getterdun

customer_reviews.title: Removes pet hair really well
customer_reviews.text: This is the best lint roller. It thoroughly removed pet hair on clothing and bedding and the sheets rip off easily and completely. I've tried a couple other brands and this is by far the best.
customer_reviews.author: Bo

customer_reviews.title: Disappointing purchase
customer_reviews.text: This lint roller is not sticky at all. I have to use multiple sheets to remove small amounts of lint. I would not purchase these again. The lint rollers I have purchased from Target (Target’s store brand) work so much better.
customer_reviews.author: DBGoode

customer_reviews.title: EXECELLENT VALUE, VERY EFFECTIVE LINT ROLLERS
customer_reviews.text: These are great value, with 95 sheet on each roller, they are long lasting. The lint rollers pick up lint and pet hair with ease. These are necessity in our household because we have 4 Pugs (Pugs shed a lot--year round) and 2 Cats. We keep these in our cars, and all over the house. Thanks to these lint rollers, after a few passes over my shirt and pants, I can go out pet hair and lint free! They are also very useful for getting pet hair off our furniture, too. As long as Amazon keeps selling these at a good price I will keep buying them!
customer_reviews.author: Pleasant

customer_reviews.title: Good value
customer_reviews.text: Picks up hair very well but has a tendency to stick to the item being cleaned and then folds or pulls the sheets. But the price is good for all the sheets you get. Each roll has twice the sheets my old lint roller had.
customer_reviews.author: Chilly Jilly

customer_reviews.title: Scotch quality
customer_reviews.text: With 2 shedding dogs, these get a lot of use. You should see the hair they pick up. I think we could make another dog from all the hair. Scotch quality. Don't cheap out on other brands. We tried, and we came back to these.
customer_reviews.author: MPB

customer_reviews.title: Not this time
customer_reviews.text: I have been purchasing these they are pretty good. My last purchase 4 of the 5 rollers the sheets kept rolling into them selves impossible to use and completely wasted the 4 rolls. I couldnt contact anyone for help on the product. Terrible
customer_reviews.author: Sam

customer_reviews.title: Super Sticky
customer_reviews.text: Super sticky and great at picking up dog hair and other fuzzies. Only gave it 4 stars because you have to be somewhat careful ripping the used sheets because the perforations tale a little tugging.
customer_reviews.author: S. Rolland

customer_reviews.title: Not meant for homes with pets, not sticky either
customer_reviews.text: For a brand like Scotch I expected more. The sticky paper is flimsy and barely hold up picking up lint, let alone hair. With one sheet on your sleeve, you have to change the paper because it’s no longer sticky with in one stroke. The sheets are hard to tear from each other. I have 4 cars and we clean constantly behind them and groom them regularly. Of course, my cats shed, these rolls did did nothing to help pick their hairs. Not what I expected. These rolls are not meant for homes with pets. It won’t pick up their hair.
customer_reviews.author: Janise Ortiz

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what was expected
customer_reviews.text: This is perfect when you don't have a place to permanently affix a holder to the wall and don't have room for a stand alone holder! I actually purchased a storage unit to go around the toilet and made this a part of it! (prior I did see how it hung off the tank and it worked just as well too!)
customer_reviews.author: Ceree

customer_reviews.title: 1 year later STILL havn't had to buy more!
customer_reviews.text: What a steal! Works great, you really get a bang for your buck with the number of sheets you get and the price for bulk buying this item... Update: It's been a year since we bought this product. We have not had to reorder yet! Husband uses them pretty regularly for his work shirt. Tears clean. Super sticky. Still have 2 untouched rollers. (guilty of having 3 opened and placed around the house) HIGHLY recommened purchase for your sticky roll needs! Don't waste your time getting them at walmart! Just buy this and store them promise it saves the headache.
customer_reviews.author: Sharrie

customer_reviews.title: Best brand of lint roller!
customer_reviews.text: I've always had a long-haired white dog that sheds, and I've tried every brand of lint roller out there. These work the BEST by far. They pick up the most per sheet, peel and tear off easily, and don't leave a sticky residue on your fingers when you peel them off like other brands.
customer_reviews.author: Shanna

customer_reviews.title: NO LONGER WORK
customer_reviews.text: I have been buying these lint rollers for years. But something has recently changed with either the paper or adhesive. Basically, the lint roll doesn't work on these anymore. Instead of being able to use roll it back and forth the paper sticks to your fabric & drags thereby pulling a ton of papers with it. Creating massive waste. This is now the SECOND set of these that has been completely ineffective. At this point I want a full refund.
customer_reviews.author: Me

customer_reviews.title: Stick with the name brand
customer_reviews.text: I have always used these for lint rollers and recently tried a less expensive brand, totally not worth it! These are far better, I'm sticking with them.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan Robison

customer_reviews.title: ... well at picking up the hair of the most adorable, most sweet
customer_reviews.text: They work well at picking up the hair of the most adorable, most sweet, and best dog in the world. I prefer the kind that is reminiscent of a paint roller because I find I can apply more pressure with that type of holder (until it breaks). Great price and face it -- if you are going to need one of these things you are going to need 5 of them!
customer_reviews.author: Richard Hayes

customer_reviews.title: Be careful when using
customer_reviews.text: Works as we would expect. One caveat, the paper is thin and can get stuck to fabric and will roll off a bunch of sheets. Be careful or be frustrated.
customer_reviews.author: Zanz

customer_reviews.title: Hard to remove used sheets.
customer_reviews.text: not easy to peel off and remove the each sheet but does the job. I find myself tearing off brand new sheets often because the suits aren't cut well.
customer_reviews.author: Annie

customer_reviews.title: Works better than any other lint roller
customer_reviews.text: Love this. I only use this stuff for cleaning myself up after my two furry friends get themselves all over me. This works better than any other lint rollers I've used. Costco used to carry this but I have not seen it there for a while. When asked them one they said this was a seasonal item (before Christmas a few years ago). I am very happy that this can be purchased from Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: Mary

customer_reviews.title: Cheaper than refills
customer_reviews.text: Why are 5 full lint rollers cheaper than the refills. I accounted for the number of sheets in the refill too. These are still cheaper. But what do we do with all the excess handles? Anyway, I have a dog going through her bi-annual shed and these work great on my work pants, sweaters, and couch. No need to pay the extra to get the pet version.
customer_reviews.author: Varnia W.

product_meta.title: Scotch-Brite Lint Roller Value Pack, 5 Rollers, 95 Sheets Per Roller, 475 Sheets Total, Works Great On Pet Hair
product_meta.description: Size:5 Count (Pack of 1)| Style:RollerLook fabulous from day until night with the Scotch-Brite Lint Roller, your little secret weapon. Whether you have a furry friend at home, or you simply need to freshen up before a big meeting, this lint roller picks up fur, fluff and other stuff so you can put your best foot forward. The ergonomic handle fits comfortably in your hand and the roller makes quick touchups a snap. Plus, it's equipped with Scotch Brand adhesive so you know you can rely on it to get the job done. Stash the Scotch-Brite Lint Roller in your home, car and office to look great wherever you go.
feature_bullets: Picks up lint, fur, fuzz, hair and debris for a crisp, clean look
Tears cleanly down to the last sheet
Handle is ergonomically designed to fit comfortably in your hand. To extend the use of this roller, use Scotch-Brite Lint Roller Refills
5 Large Rollers, 95 Sheets per Roller, 475 Sheets Total
Reliable Scotch Brand adhesive ; Handle Material : Plastic
Great for use on clothing, furniture and more. The lint roller can also be used on pants, coats, sweaters, dresses, suits and formal wear

specifications.Domestic Shipping: Currently, item can be shipped only within the U.S. and to APO/FPO addresses. For APO/FPO shipments, please check with the manufacturer regarding warranty and support issues.
specifications.International Shipping: This item can be shipped to select countries outside of the U.S.
